text: [[b]]RANGED BLOCK CHANCE[[/b]]\\n\\n Increases the chance of evading damage from non-artillery projectiles.
[[b]]MELEE CHARGE BONUS[[/b]]\\n\\n Increases a unit's hit chance and damage when charging. Fades over time after the initial charge.
[[b]]MORALE[[/b]]\\n\\n Determines this unit's resilience to routing. When the general is dead, units cannot rally.
[[b]]ARMOUR - BASE[[/b]]\\n\\n Decreases standard melee, ranged and explosion damages. Doesn't help against armour-piercing damage.

[[b]]MELEE POWER[[/b]]\\n\\n Determines how much damage a unit can cause in melee.\\n\\n Defined by:\\n  - Melee Attack Rate\\n  - Melee Damage - Base\\n  - Melee Damage - Armour-piercing\\n  - Melee Charge Bonus

[[b]]MELEE TOUGHNESS[[/b]]\\n\\n Determines how resistant a unit is against melee attacks.\\n\\n Defined by:\\n - Hit Points\\n - Armour - Base\\n - Armour - Shield\\n - Melee Evasion - Base\\n - Melee Evasion - Shield
[[b]]MELEE ATTACK RATE[[/b]]\\n\\n Determines how many times a unit can attack over a minute.
[[b]]MELEE DAMAGE - BASE[[/b]]\\n\\n Can be blocked. Reduced by armour.
[[b]]SPEED[[/b]]\\n\\n Determines how quickly this unit can move. Affected by terrain.
Determines how much damage a unit can withstand without dying.\\n\\n Armour, Melee Evasion and Ranged Block Chance help to further increase survivability.
[[b]]MELEE EVASION - SHIELD[[/b]]\\n\\n Increases the chance of evading melee damage from the front.
[[b]]AMMUNITION[[/b]]\\n\\n Determines how many times a unit can fire. After the battle, ammunition is fully replenished.
[[b]]HIT POINTS[[/b]]\\n\\n Determines how much damage a unit can withstand without dying. Armour, Melee Evasion and Ranged Block Chance helps to further increase survivability.

[[b]]RANGED TOUGHNESS[[/b]]\\n\\n Determines how resistant a unit is against ranged attacks.\\n\\n Defined by:\\n - Hit Points\\n - Armour - Base\\n - Armour - Shield\\n - Ranged Block Chance - Base\\n - Ranged Block Chance - Shield
[[b]]RANGE[[/b]]\\n\\n Determines the maximum distance across which this unit can fire. Range is visible in battle when the unit is selected.
[[b]]MASS[[/b]]\\n\\n Defines the weight of the unit, which determines how impactful a cavalry charge is, and to what extent infantry can resist one.
[[b]]ARMOUR - SHIELD[[/b]]\\n\\n Decreases standard melee and ranged damage from the front. Doesn't help against armour-piercing damage.
[[b]]RANGED ATTACK RATE[[/b]]\\n\\n Determines how many times a unit can fire over a minute.
[[b]]RANGED EXPLOSION - ARMOUR-PIERCING[[/b]]\\n\\n Cannot be blocked. Ignores armour.
[[b]]RANGED EXPLOSION - BASE[[/b]]\\n\\n Cannot be blocked. Reduced by armour.
Decreases standard melee, ranged and explosion damage.\\n\\n Doesn't help against armour-piercing damage.
[[b]]MELEE DAMAGE - ARMOUR-PIERCING[[/b]]\\n\\n It fully goes through armour but can be blocked.
[[b]]HIT CHANCE[[/b]]\\n\\n Increases the chance of hitting the enemy target by decreasing its Melee Evasion.

[[b]]RANGED POWER[[/b]]\\n\\n Determines how much damage a unit can cause from range.\\n\\n Defined by:\\n - Ranged Attack Rate\\n - Ranged Damage - Base\\n - Ranged Damage - Armour-piercing\\n - Ranged Explosion - Base\\n - Ranged Explosion - Armour-piercing
[[b]]RANGED DAMAGE - ARMOUR-PIERCING[[/b]]\\n\\n Can be blocked. Ignores armour.
The damage caused by a unit's melee weapon is split between standard and armour-piercing.\\n\\n Armour-piercing damage ignores armour; standard damage is reduced by it.
[[b]]MELEE EVASION - BASE[[/b]]\\n\\n Increases the chance of evading melee damage from front and side. The enemy's charge bonus decreases it.
Determines the distance at which this unit can spot enemies.\\n\\n Hiding units will not be spotted at this range.
[[b]]RANGED ATTACK RATE[[/b]]\\n\\n Determines how many times a unit can fire over a minute.
[[b]]RANGED DAMAGE - BASE[[/b]]\\n\\n Can be blocked. Reduced by armour.
Determines the likelihood of hitting the enemy when firing.
